definition: Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
lit. One doesn't visit a temple without a cause. (idiom)/fig. to visit sb with an ulterior motive (esp. to ask for sth)/having a hidden agenda
pinyin: wu2 shi4 bu4 deng1 san1 bao3 dian4

sentences.english: I no thing dun come three palace, so i come to find you.
sentences.chinese: 我無事不登三寶殿，所以便來找你。

sentences.english: The midway of funicular at Chi-Nan Temple, Mu-Cha, Taipei.
sentences.chinese: 木柵指南宮旁大雄寶殿山下的索道臺車之中途。

sentences.english: The arrival point of funicular track at Chi-Nan Temple, Mu-Cha, Taipei.
sentences.chinese: 木柵指南宮旁大雄寶殿山下的索道臺車之著點。

sentences.english: The legend goes that Wang was a warrior of Emperor Yuhuang guarding Lingxiao Palace.
sentences.chinese: 傳說王靈官原爲玉皇大帝凌霄寶殿前的一名武士。

sentences.english: Supposes the sound thorough room hall in the Sakyamuni valuable palace east side, named kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 在大雄寶殿東側設有素齋館，名爲香積廚。

sentences.english: Yesterday, we visited Daxiong temple hall of Shaolin Temple.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我們參觀了少林寺的大雄寶殿。

definition: marble pillar (ornamental column in front of places, tombs)
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
to pass on the light of Buddha
Yanshou county in Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Heilongjiang/to extend life
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
pattra palm tree (Corypha umbraculifera), whose leaves were used as paper substitute for Buddhist sutras
Jianzhen or Ganjin (688-763), Tang dynastic Buddhist monk, who crossed to Japan after several unsuccessful attempts, influential in Japanese Buddhism
